dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Apple Inc. (AAPL): Slower Revenue Growth vs. Ecosystem Durability – What Wins?
News Content: We recently published a list of Top 10 Trending AI Stocks on Wall Street. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stands against other top trending AI stocks on Wall Street.

President Donald Trump has recently announced a private sector investment to build more AI data centers, marking yet another effort by the US government to stay ahead in the race for supremacy in artificial intelligence.

A prominent player in the field has been OpenAI, the artificial intelligence startup known to have started the AI arms race in the first place. In its latest, OpenAI has recently previewed an AI agent that can carry out tasks on the web for users. This move seeks to enhance its chatbot amidst intensifying competition.

READ ALSO: 10 Buzzing AI Stocks on Latest News and Ratings and 11 AI Stocks That Should Be On Your Watchlist

Dubbed the “Operator”, the tool is powered by a model that allows it to interact with on-screen buttons, menus, and text fields.

“This capability marks the next step in AI development, allowing models to use the same tools humans rely on daily and opening the door to a vast range of new applications”.

OpenAI says Operator is “an agent that can go to the web to perform tasks for you”. As such, companies are increasingly using agents like these to assist in tasks and execute actions without direct human intervention. Currently available to Pro users in the US, the Operator can perform numerous tasks, such as creating to-do lists or assisting in planning vacations.

The company states that it eventually plans to expand the Operator to Plus, Team, and Enterprise users and will be integrating Operator into ChatGPT. It also revealed how the tool currently faces trouble with some tasks, such as managing calendars and creating slideshows.

“Operator is one of our first agents, which are AIs capable of doing work for you independently. You give it a task and it will execute it”.

Based on trends in artificial intelligence, agents are the next big advancement in the AI field. Even Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang agrees that they are. Artificial Intelligence agents are autonomous intelligent systems that can perform specific tasks without human intervention.

“AI agents are going to get deployed. I think this year we’re going to see it take off”.

According to him, areas such as software engineering, digital marketing, and customer service are the first where AI agents can add value. As for his company, it is already using AI agents in chip design.

Story Continues

For this article, we selected AI stocks by going through news articles, stock analysis, and press releases. These stocks are also popular among hedge funds.

Why are we interested in the stocks that hedge funds pile into? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points (see more details here).Apple Inc. (AAPL): Expanding AI Features with Apple Intelligence and Ecosystem Strength

A wide view of an Apple store, showing the range of products the company offers.

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)

Number of Hedge Fund Holders: 158

Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is a technology company that recently launched Apple Intelligence, its intelligence system. One of the biggest analyst calls for Thursday, January 23, has been for Apple Inc. Goldman Sachs reiterated the stock as “Buy” and lowered its price target to $280 per share from $286. The price target downgrade, driven by lower iPhone sales, comes ahead of the company’s December-quarter earnings report next week. The firm anticipates the tech giant to report fiscal Q1 earnings per share of $2.35, in line with consensus, and revenue of $124.2B versus the consensus of $124.8B. According to the firm, even though the competition within the Chinese market is increasing, it is optimistic about accelerating iPhone growth in fiscal 2026. This iPhone growth will largely be driven by the continued rollout of Apple Intelligence with a more robust feature set.

“We anticipate market sentiment to improve midyear, which is a seasonally strong period for the stock, as concerns about Apple Intelligence’s limited impact on iPhone demand and competition in China are replaced by optimism over the new slate of Apple Intelligence features revealed at WWDC 2025, the launch of new Mac, iPad and iPhone SE products in spring 2025, and potential new features for the iPhone 17/18 in fall 2025/26”.

Overall, AAPL ranks 2nd on our list of top trending AI stocks on Wall Street. While we acknowledge the potential of AAPL as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter time frame. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than AAPL but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

READ NEXT: 20 Best AI Stocks To Buy Now and Complete List of 59 AI Companies Under $2 Billion in Market Cap

Disclosure: None. This article is originally published at Insider Monkey.

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news headline pertains specifically to investing in the Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF, which is not directly related to Apple Inc.'s core business operations or performance. Since the information provided doesn't have any significant implications for Apple's stock price, it is unlikely to cause major movements either way. Therefore, I estimate a neutral probability of rise or fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While Apple is incorporating AI (Apple Intelligence) into its products and has strong ecosystem durability, the revenue growth is slowing. Goldman Sachs lowered the price target, citing lower iPhone sales, even though they maintain a "Buy" rating. The article suggests optimism for future iPhone growth driven by Apple Intelligence rollout but not until fiscal 2026. Competition in China is cited as a present concern, with potential sentiment improvement midyear based on future developments. The article also emphasizes 'superior' AI stocks than AAPL that can deliver a shorter time frame with significant returns, implying that in the short term AAPL isn't the best choice for an investor. Furthermore, the article implies that some hedge funds are buying 'other' trending AI stocks, suggesting potentially increased investment in 'other' AI companies than AAPL. Due to the mixed signals, slightly more weight is given to the negative elements (slower growth, price target downgrade, competition) than the long-term potential, indicating a slightly higher probability of a stock price fall in the short-term.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news focuses on the profitability of streaming services in 2024, highlighting the collective success of major players like Netflix, Disney, and others. While this is generally positive, the article also emphasizes significant challenges.  These include maintaining profitability (margins are still low for most except Netflix), combating subscriber churn in the face of price increases, and the competitive landscape.  The uncertainty around the sustainability of this newfound profitability and the potential limitations of growth (both subscriber base and price increases) create a cautious outlook. While the positive news of streaming profits could initially boost Apple's stock (as Apple TV+ is part of their services segment), the overall cautious tone regarding the future of streaming profitability and the article's focus on other companies limits the extent of the positive impact.  Therefore, the probability of a stock price rise is lower than a neutral probability (0.5), and a price fall, driven by concerns about the broader streaming market, is more likely.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news highlights a rare underperform rating from Jefferies, citing weak iPhone shipments and lackluster consumer interest in AI features, which could dampen revenue growth. Additionally, challenges in China and potential risks from the Alphabet antitrust case add to the negative outlook. However, Apple's strong services revenue and high-margin business model provide some counterbalance. Given the rarity of such downgrades and the immediate market reaction they often trigger, the probability of a stock price fall is higher in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The analysis is based on the news that Apple Inc. received a rare underperform rating from a Wall Street analyst due to weak iPhone shipments and lack of consumer interest in AI features. The analyst expects Apple to miss revenue estimates and has set a price target of $200.75. Despite this, Apple has a strong business model with high-margin services revenue, which could offset the decline in iPhone sales. However, the company faces risks such as the Alphabet antitrust case and increasing competition in China. Given the mixed outlook, the probability of the stock price rising is lower than the probability of it falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The financial news indicates that a well-known investor, Steven Cohen, has sold Apple stock and invested in a lesser-known AI company with strong performance. Investors often view such moves by experts as significant indicators. However, Cohen's move alone is not definitive proof of Apple's future performance. The effect on Apple's stock could be negative if it causes other investors to lose confidence, but it might also be viewed as an opportunity for a buy-the-rumor-sell-the-news scenario. Overall, this news could have a slightly negative impact.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news headline discusses how to invest in the Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI), which does not have a direct impact on Apple's business operations or financial outlook. Most previous analyses indicated a mixture of challenges for Apple including slow revenue growth, competition, and negative ratings from analysts. The neutral nature of the news suggests that it will not significantly influence investor sentiment positively or negatively for Apple. Given the mixed signals from analysts emphasizing both caution and potential long-term growth, I estimate a slight edge towards a stock price fall, aligning with the previously observed trends. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a similar cautious stance taken by other models.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The article presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While it discusses the company's foray into AI with 'Apple Intelligence' and mentions Goldman Sachs' 'Buy' rating, the analyst firm also lowered its price target due to concerns about slowing iPhone sales and increased competition in China. The article suggests potential improvements in sentiment mid-year based on upcoming product launches and new AI features, but also highlights that other AI stocks might offer higher returns in a shorter timeframe. Considering the slightly negative immediate impact of the price target downgrade and caution concerning 'other AI stocks', this reinforces the previous rounds which show a negative outlook. Therefore, I predict a slightly higher probability of the stock price falling in the short term. However, sentiment may change following the release of future AI plans.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news focuses on the profitability of streaming services in 2024, which is positive for the overall media landscape. However, the article emphasizes the challenges faced by these companies: maintaining profitability with low margins (except for Netflix), combating subscriber churn due to price increases, and intense competition. While Apple's Apple TV+ is included in their services, this news has limited direct impact on Apple's stock price.  The article's focus is on other companies, and the overall cautious outlook regarding the future of streaming profitability outweighs the potential positive impact on Apple.  The previous predictions show a range of opinions, with a general leaning towards a higher probability of a price fall.  Considering the indirect relevance and the general uncertainty about the long-term sustainability of streaming profits for even the dominant players, I predict a slightly higher probability of a price fall for Apple, although the effect will likely be minimal because the news is not directly related to Apple’s core business.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights a rare underperform rating from Jefferies, citing weak iPhone shipments and lackluster consumer interest in AI features, which could dampen revenue growth. Additionally, challenges in China and potential risks from the Alphabet antitrust case add to the negative outlook. However, Apple's strong services revenue and high-margin business model provide some counterbalance. Given the rarity of such downgrades and the immediate market reaction they often trigger, the probability of a stock price fall is higher in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The provided news headline and content focus on the profitability of streaming services in 2024, specifically mentioning major players like Netflix, Disney, Paramount, NBCUniversal's Peacock, and Warner Bros. Discovery's Max. The news highlights that these companies collectively reported a profit for the first time, but also emphasizes the challenges ahead, such as maintaining profitability, combating subscriber churn, and the competitive landscape. Apple's stock (AAPL) is not directly mentioned in the news. However, as Apple has its own streaming service, Apple TV+, the positive trend in the streaming industry could have a mildly positive impact on Apple's stock. Nonetheless, the cautious tone regarding the future of streaming profitability and the focus on other companies limit the extent of the positive impact. Given the neutral to slightly positive implications for Apple, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news about Apple Inc. receiving a rare underperform rating from Jefferies due to weak iPhone shipments and lack of consumer interest in AI features presents a mixed outlook. On one hand, Apple's strong business model with high-margin services revenue provides a counterbalance. On the other hand, the company faces risks such as the Alphabet antitrust case and increasing competition in China. Considering the predictions from other models, which indicate a trend towards a higher probability of the stock price falling, and taking into account the potential impact of the underperform rating and the challenges in the market, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The financial news highlights that Steven Cohen, a well-known billionaire investor, has sold his Apple stock and invested in a little-known AI stock that has seen significant gains. Such decisions made by experienced investors often influence the confidence of retail investors. Moreover, the news mentions specific concerns about the future revenue growth of Apple due to slower iPhone sales and increasing competition in markets like China. There is also reference to the Alphabet antitrust case, which adds another layer of risk. The combined effect of these factors points towards a negative sentiment, potentially leading to a decline in Apple's stock price.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news headline, which focuses on investing in the Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI), has no direct relevance to Apple's core business operations or recent performance metrics. Previous analyses indicate a mix of concerns surrounding Apple, such as slowing revenue growth, competition, and analyst downgrades linked to weak iPhone sales. While there are mentions of potential long-term growth opportunities, particularly in AI, the overall sentiment from earlier predictions leans slightly negative considering the external pressures Apple faces. Given the neutral nature of the current news and the prevailing negative sentiment from the past predictions, I estimate a slightly higher probability of a stock price fall than a rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed but slightly negative outlook for Apple. While Apple is investing in AI ('Apple Intelligence') and has a strong ecosystem, there are concerns about slower revenue growth and increasing competition in China. Goldman Sachs lowered its price target, despite maintaining a 'Buy' rating. The focus on 'other AI stocks' that may offer faster returns also suggests that AAPL is not the optimal choice for immediate gains. Previous predictions trended toward a slightly higher probability of a price fall. Given these factors, I lean slightly towards a negative short-term outlook, but the company's long-term AI investments and ecosystem strength prevent a strongly negative prediction. There is a slight increase in predicted rise probability based on the trend of previous estimations.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news focuses on the profitability of streaming services in 2024, which is indirectly relevant to Apple through its Apple TV+ service. While the overall trend of streaming profitability is positive, the article highlights significant challenges: maintaining profitability with low margins (except Netflix), combating subscriber churn with price increases, and intense competition.  The article's cautious tone regarding the long-term sustainability of streaming profits outweighs the potential positive impact on Apple.  The news is not directly about Apple, and the impact on its stock price will likely be minimal. Considering the previous predictions which show a general trend towards a higher probability of a price fall for Apple, and the lack of direct relevance and uncertainty surrounding the news, I predict a slightly higher probability of a price fall, although the effect is likely to be small.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights a rare underperform rating from Jefferies, citing weak iPhone shipments and lackluster consumer interest in AI features, which could dampen revenue growth. Additionally, challenges in China and potential risks from the Alphabet antitrust case add to the negative outlook. However, Apple's strong services revenue and high-margin business model provide some counterbalance. Given the rarity of such downgrades and the immediate market reaction they often trigger, the probability of a stock price fall is higher in the short term. Previous predictions also indicate a trend towards a higher probability of the stock price falling, aligning with the negative sentiment from the news.

Discovery's Max. While the news is generally positive for the streaming industry, it does not directly relate to Apple's core business operations. However, as Apple has its own streaming service, Apple TV+, the positive trend in the streaming industry could have a mildly positive impact on Apple's stock. The cautious tone regarding the future of streaming profitability and the focus on other companies limit the extent of the positive impact. Given the neutral to slightly positive implications for Apple, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling.

This, combined with challenges in China and potential risks from the Alphabet antitrust case, presents a negative outlook. However, Apple's strong services revenue and high-margin business model provide some counterbalance. Considering the rarity of such downgrades and the immediate market reaction they often trigger, the probability of a stock price fall is higher in the short term. Such decisions made by experienced investors often influence the confidence of retail investors. Moreover, the news mentions specific concerns about the future revenue growth of Apple due to slower iPhone sales and increasing competition in markets like China. There is also reference to the Alphabet antitrust case, which adds another layer of risk. The combined effect of these factors points towards a negative sentiment, potentially leading to a decline in Apple's stock price.
Round: 3
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news headline focuses on how to invest in the Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI), which does not have direct implications for Apple Inc.'s core operations or immediate performance. The previous predictions reflect a consensus of caution regarding Apple's growth prospects due to analyst downgrades and market competition, particularly concerning iPhone sales and AI adoption. The overall sentiment has trended negatively, with several models predicting a higher likelihood of a stock price decline. Given the neutrality of the news combined with existing concerns from prior analyses, I estimate a slightly higher probability of Apple's stock price falling than rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news focuses on Apple's AI efforts and acknowledges slower revenue growth while highlighting the durability of its ecosystem. While Apple is incorporating AI (Apple Intelligence), Goldman Sachs lowered the price target due to slower iPhone sales and increased competition in China. There is some optimism for long-term growth, driven by Apple Intelligence and new product launches, however it also highlights 'superior' AI stocks than AAPL that can deliver a shorter time frame with improved returns, suggesting that in the short term AAPL isn't the best choice for an investor. Previous rounds of predictions also showed a predominantly negative outlook. Considering these mixed signals, and the slight increase in predicted rise probability based on the trend of previous estimations, I predict a slightly higher probability of the stock price falling, however it will be less significant than the prediction in round 2.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news focuses on the profitability of streaming services in 2024, which is indirectly relevant to Apple due to its Apple TV+ service. While the overall trend of streaming profitability is positive, the article highlights significant challenges: maintaining profitability with low margins (except Netflix), combating subscriber churn due to price increases, and intense competition. This presents a mixed picture for Apple, as the success of Apple TV+ could benefit from this trend but the overall uncertainty in the streaming market makes it unclear how much this will impact Apple's stock.  The news is not directly about Apple, and the impact on its stock price will likely be minimal.  Previous predictions show a general trend towards a slightly higher probability of a price fall for Apple, which I agree with.  However, the overall impact of this news is likely to be small. Therefore, I give slightly more weight to the probability of the stock falling than rising, reflecting the overall cautious sentiment about the sustainability of the streaming profits mentioned in the article and the past predictions of models.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows:
